elements.title: mountain neinei (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the New Zealand tree mountain neinei (example pictured) can live for up to 600 years?

elements.title: Kazimierz Kowalski (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as general director of the Grand Theatre in Łódź, bass singer Kazimierz Kowalski led a worldwide television broadcast of Moniuszko's The Haunted Manor?

elements.title: United States national motto (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that two school districts in Kentucky protested against a statewide mandate to hang a copy of the United States national motto by showing oversized $1 bills and 1¢ coins, which contain the motto?

elements.title: Nurmuhemmet Tohti (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the death of Uyghur writer Nurmuhemmet Tohti has been linked to mistreatment in the Xinjiang internment camps, a claim China denies?

elements.title: James B. Duke House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that New York City's James B. Duke House was modeled after a French chateau and designed by an architect who did not have a formal architectural education?

elements.title: Jodie Lewis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dr. Jodie Lewis led a team of students from the University of Worcester and volunteer archaeologists in excavating the first timber circle discovered in Somerset?

elements.title: Bubsy 3D (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that while Bubsy 3D is often labeled as one of the worst video games of all time, it had a positive to mixed reception around its initial release?

elements.title: KiHa 183 series (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that you could travel with stuffed animals on the Asahiyama Zoo KiHa 183 series train service?
